steps: Chop the shrimp until they are a pulp.
Chop the celery, green onion, cilantro and add to a bowl with the shrimp.
Add the sesame oil, cornstarch, soy sauce, egg, and then mix.
Slice the crust off of the bread, and cut diagonal into triangles.
Spread the mixture evenly onto the bread, covering the whole thing.
Heat the vegetable oil to 375 in a dutch oven or similar safe vessel to fry. Then add the covered slices of bread.
Cook until golden, and all the pieces finished.
suggestions: Add a minced water chestnut or two. Also pairs terrifically with the Gochujang Mayo.
starters.background: Shrimp Toast is a very popular appetizer in China, that has spread to Hong Kong and the United States. I got this recipe from Owen Han on Instagram, and he's definitely worth a follow.

steps: Slice the French baguette on a bias and butter one side. Add to an oven preheated to 350 degrees and cook until golden toasted.
While the bread cooks, dice the tomatoes and add to a mixing bowl.
Mince the garlic, roll the basil leaves together and cut into strips, and add them to the bowl.
Add the olive oil to the mixture, and salt to taste.
Top the toasted baguette with the mixture and enjoy.
suggestions: Add some more minced garlic to the bread as it toasts in the oven for a little more garlic flavor, or add some sliced Mozzarella between the bread and tomato mixture. If you decide to do this, add just a little Olive Oil to the bread.
starters.background: This is just a recipe I've loved forever. It's always so satisfying. I like making it in summer as a picnic snack at the beach.

steps: Put all the ingredients into a blender and blend.
Salt to taste.
suggestions: Experiment as you like, but I've found the Sherry vinegar is what makes this work.
dressings-sauces-salsas.background: I got the idea for this salsa from my mom, but made my own version.

steps: Zest the lemon and squeeze the juice into a bowl.
Add the rest of the ingredients and stir together.
suggestions: Add some grated garlic or ginger for some extra flavor.
dressings-sauces-salsas.background: This comes from Owen Han on Instagram, and goes perfectly with the Shrimp Toast recipe.

steps: Finely chop the shallot, chile, and garlic and add to a mixing bowl.
Chop the Cilantro, Parsley, and Oregano and add to the bowl.
Add the other ingredients and add salt to taste.
suggestions: It's still delicious without the chile pepper, if you are not a fan of hot peppers
dressings-sauces-salsas.background: This recipe comes from a magazine and goes great with red meats.

steps: Zest and Juice the lemon and add to a mixing bowl or measuring cup.
Mince the garlic and add.
Add the rest of the ingredients and mix together thoroughly, add salt to taste.
Taste to see if the acid and fat are balanced.
suggestions: This is my families favorite salad dressing to make. Our go to mix for this dressing is Arugula, Raspberries (any acid berry is great), Roasted sunflower seeds, and Avocado. It goes great as a side for a steak.
dressings-sauces-salsas.background: This recipe comes from Samin Nosrat.

steps: Put the water in a pan with a lid and get to a simmer. Once simmering add the green beans and salt to taste.
Stir the green beans every minute or two and cook for 7 minutes.
Drain any remaining water, then turn the heat up medium-high and add the olive oil and garlic in a well in between the green beans.
Stir the ingredients and cook until the garlic is fragrant and then serve.
sides.background: This recipe comes from Samin Nosrat and is amazingly simple and delicious.

steps: Cut the potatoes and carrots and cover in the cooking oil and spread them out on a baking sheet. Put in the oven at 400 degrees for 45 minutes.
Once the potatoes can be pierced easily with the tines of a fork, take them out and add to a mixing bowl.
Add the rest of the ingredients and mix them together, add salt to taste, and then taste to see if the balance of acid and fat are good.
suggestions: You can speed up the cooking of the potatoes by raising the heat, but I find 400 gets the best results.
sides.background: I made this recipe after I wanted a way to make roasted potatoes more interesting, and this is what I came up with.

steps: Cook the pasta to the Al Dente time on the box.
Add the olive oil to a pan and turn the heat to low-med.
Add the bacon and fresh ground pepper and let it cook until the bacon is almost done but not crispy.
Save the 1 cup of Pasta Water and drain the rest.
Add the pasta water to the pan with the pasta and stir vigorously to emulsify it all together.
Top with salt, parmesan, and more black pepper as needed.
suggestions: Sometimes I like to add parboiled greens when I mix it all together, usually broccoli.
main-dishes.background: This is really Pasta alla Gricia, but I can never find Guanciale (cured pork cheek), so I use bacon. It's been a family favorite for a long time.

steps: Start by cooking the pasta the recommended Al Dente time.
Chop the onion, bell pepper, and garlic. Cook in oil until onions are translucent and everything is nice and fragrant.
Add the ground beef and break the meat apart. Add the chili powder, oregano, cumin, and salt.
Continue breaking the ground beef up as it cooks and mix the spices, meat, and vegetables together until the meat is almost finished. Then add the tomato sauce.
Mix the finished pasta into the meat sauce in an oven safe dish or cast iron pan and top with the grated cheese
Place in an oven preheated to 350° and cook for 50 minutes.
suggestions: Top with some fresh red salsa or Tapatio.
main-dishes.background: This recipe was created by my (John Culleeny IV) great grandmother from Alaska. It has always been one of my favorite dishes throughout life, and the smell of the onion, bell pepper, and garlic always got me excited for dinner.

steps: Set your oven to 475 degrees.
Put a cast iron pan on medium high heat and let warm.
When the pan is nice, hot, and smokey, add the oil and then the chicken thighs face down. Let cook for for 2 minutes.
Turn the heat down to medium-low and let the chicken cook for another 10 minutes without touching it.
After the 10 minutes, and the oven is preheated, add the rest of the ingredients mixed in between the thighs.
Place in the oven for 15 minutes then check the inner temperature is 165 degrees and serve.
suggestions: You could also do the chicken with any aromatic herb of your liking, and also do mushrooms.
main-dishes.background: I found this amazing recipe on a blog called 'A Girl and Her Fork', and have used it all the time since. It's real easy using two cast iron pans to make chicken thighs for the week. They reheat very well and stay delicious.

steps: Cook the pasta to the Al Dente time on the box.
Add the olive oil to a pan, heat to low, and add the garlic minced.
Let the garlic cook until it is just turning golden and smells delicious, then add the canned tomatoes.
Bring to a boil and then turn to a simmer for 10-20 minutes.
Drain the pasta and add to the sauce.
suggestions: I like cooking Italian sausages before starting the sauce and then adding them to it while it simmers. You could add any protein you like though.
main-dishes.background: This recipe is a favorite of my Dad's, and he loves to make it. He made sure I knew how to make it before I went off to college.
